result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary J Leiterman

records.addlTxt: ADA Valerian Powell appeared for the State. Attorney Kara M. Rolf appeared in person with Defn. STC scheduled, NIH.
Status conference on December 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on November 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

2:45 pm Defendant Zachary J Leiterman in court, in custody.  Attorney Kara M Rolf in court for Zachary J Leiterman.  Attorney Valerian Powell in court for State of Wisconsin. Witness VoO Det William Jansen, duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA Powell. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Rolf. Redirect exam by ADA Powell. Exam by CT. Recross exam by Atty Rolf. Witness excused at 3:07 pm. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over and moves to dismiss. Argument by Atty Rolf. Argument by ADA Powell. CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 2.
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case scheduled to prelim at the request of Atty Rolf.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

03:19 PM Defendant appeared.  Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has applied for SPD, approved but no one is appointed yet.  Case rescheduled.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)].  
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol.  
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Andres L. or Joshua M. 
  - Defendant shall not be at 220 Walnut St in Oregon.
  Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 2

02:42 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
